title: LDAP Agent - MediationZone Documentation 9.4 - InfoZone
text: This section describes the LDAP agent. This is a processing agent for realtime workflow configurations. The LDAP agent can be used to establish LDAP sessions to servers when a workflow is started. Data can be sent to the LDAP agent in a UDR, which in turn communicates with the LDAP server and sends a request. The LDAP agent is in compliance with RFC 4511. For further information on the Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP), see RFC 4511: Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP): The Protocol . Open Example of a workflow with the LDAP agent There are a number of UDR types specifically for the LDAP agent. See LDAP Agent UDRs for more information on the UDRs. Operations Supported The LDAP agent supports the following operations: Abandon Add Compare Delete Extended Operation Modify ModifyDN Search Prerequisites The reader of this information should be familiar with: LDAP version 3 and the terminology used within RFC 4511, RFC 4511: Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP): The Protocol This section contains the following subsections: LDAP Agent Configuration LDAP Agent UDRs LDAP Agent Input/Output Data and MIM LDAP Agent Events LDAP Agent Example
